description: Rada Miskovic privately debates whether to expose the secret amnesty protocol. She ultimately chooses not to reveal it, fearing destabilization, and drafts a broadcast calling for citizen-led action instead.
Rada delivers a live state media broadcast, urging a paper-based citywide referendum to decide Stenograd's future—restoration of pre-BCI rule, rebuilding BCI, or permanent grassroots governance.

Printed referendum materials are distributed to all neighborhoods. Debates erupt as Council factions, Innovators, Harmonists, Directorate, and new grassroots leaders launch campaigns to sway public opinion.
Grassroots forums multiply, while Council-backed rallies escalate. Public discourse grows heated, with occasional reports of ballot tampering and intimidation fueling distrust in the process.
Referendum results are announced: no option secures a majority. Political stalemate leads to urgent negotiations, and spontaneous civic coalitions emerge across Stenograd to fill the leadership gap.
